channel.title: How to make a windows xp account hidden
channel.description:
i want to make a account on my mom's computer, but i want it to be hidden like if there are 3 accounts at the login screen, i want to make a account, but it will be hidden
so - if there are 3 account at first, i make 1, and there will still be 3 accounts in the login screen.
is this possible?

item.title: How to make a windows xp account hidden
item.description:
@702 wrote:

Yes you can…
Once your acc is created go run>type in “control userpasswords2”> advanced> advanced> double click users folder> right click your account name> check account is disabled>ok>ok>

When you want to log on next time press ctr+alt+del on the login page

Read full topic
item.source: How to make a windows xp account hidden

item.title: How to make a windows xp account hidden
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Lol its quite funny… my computer doesnt have any logins… it comes up with the “Click you username to begin” Screen though… i couldnt work out what to do for a few days then i read ona website that if you press “Ctrl + alt + delete” twice then it will come up with a seperate log in screen thing.

Read full topic

item.source: How to make a windows xp account hidden

item.title: How to make a windows xp account hidden
item.dc:creator: @LegendaryLoser .Flair
item.description:
@LegendaryLoser wrote:

[quote=“arraness14, post:8, topic:66282”]yes you can. Dont say you cant when you dont know please.

  1. Make the account
  2. Download windows powertoys tweakUI (or similar, google it)
  3. When you open it its easy. On one of the tabs you can pick what user to hide and see.
  4. Uninstall and delete TweakUI and the account is still hidden.

I have about 2 on mine incase my parents limit me to limited account.[/quote]
I was almost positive lol just kidding oh well but hey thanks for how to do it

Read full topic
item.source: How to make a windows xp account hidden

item.title: How to make a windows xp account hidden
item.dc:creator: @arraness14 arraness14
item.description:
@arraness14 wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:9, topic:66282”]Isn’t there the option to make it hidden when the account is created?

Or why don’t you just make an account in the C:\Documents and Settings\ folder and just touch up the registry a bit?[/quote]

Because not all people are as smart as us my friend.

Read full topic

item.source: How to make a windows xp account hidden

item.title: How to make a windows xp account hidden
item.dc:creator: @arraness14 arraness14
item.description:
@arraness14 wrote:

yes you can. Dont say you cant when you dont know please.

  1. Make the account
  2. Download windows powertoys tweakUI (or similar, google it)
  3. When you open it its easy. On one of the tabs you can pick what user to hide and see.
  4. Uninstall and delete TweakUI and the account is still hidden.

I have about 2 on mine incase my parents limit me to limited account.

Read full topic
